question: The principle that equal volumes of all gases contain the same number of molecules when under the same conditions of pressure and temperature was given by?
explanation: Amedeo Avogadro (1776 - 1856) was an Italian scientist who came up with Avogadro's law which states that equal volumes of all gases contain the same number of molecules when under the same conditions of pressure and temperature. The Avogadro constant was named after him.
